node.title: Kylie was against getting vaccinated. But something changed her mind.
node.alt: A woman stands with her 3 teenage children and her younger daughter.
node.description: Tasmania is about to reach a significant COVID-19 vaccination milestone, with 90 per cent of the state's population over 16 having had at least one dose. But as the state moves closer to opening, vaccination rates for a vulnerable sectionÂ of the population is lagging.
node.content:
["For months, Kylie Battese had no intention of getting vaccinated against COVID-19.\u00a0", "But on a Thursday afternoon at Launceston's Tasmanian Aboriginal Centre, Ms Battese was lining up with her kids for a shot in the arm.\u00a0", "\"I needed to understand [the vaccine], and the way he said it was the way I could understand it.", "\"It wasn't in doctor terms, it was really good. So I was like, 'Yep, we're getting this done.'\"", "Ms Battese's family might be getting vaccinated, but there is still a wide gap between the vaccination rates of Tasmania's Aboriginal population and the state's broader population.\u00a0", "Federal government data shows about 73 per cent of Tasmania's Aboriginal population aged over 15 have had one dose of a vaccine, and about 58 per cent are fully vaccinated.\u00a0", "That compares with data on the overall Tasmanian population, which shows almost 90 per cent of people over 16 have had one dose, and more than 76 per cent are fully vaccinated.", "The Indigenous vaccination data is split into four regions.\u00a0", "In Hobart, 76 per cent of the Aboriginal Tasmanian population has had one dose, while 59.55 per cent are fully vaccinated.", "The west and north-west of Tasmania have\u00a0the lowest Indigenous vaccination figures of the state, at 68.9 per cent first dose and 55 per cent fully vaccinated.\u00a0", "
Changing advice played into hesitancy
", "Lisa Coulson from the Tasmanian Aboriginal Centre (TAC)\u00a0said the lower vaccination rates were concerning, especially ahead of the state's border reopening next month.\u00a0", "\"In part\u00a0because of the high rates of chronic disease in Aboriginal patients and Aboriginal community members, so that makes them a lot more vulnerable if and when COVID comes to Tasmania,\" Ms Coulson said.\u00a0", "", "
Lisa Coulson\u00a0is working\u00a0to help close the gap through her work at the Tasmanian Aboriginal Centre.(ABC News: Piia Wirsu)
", "She said there were a range of factors for the lower vaccination rate.\u00a0", "Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander communities were given priority access to vaccines as the rollout commenced.", "But the Commonwealth's vaccine advisory body changed its advice regarding AstraZeneca in April, recommending it should not be used in the under-50s because of an associated rare blood clotting condition.", "A couple of months later, ATAGI changed its advice again,\u00a0recommending the jab should not be given to anyone under 60.", "\"For the Aboriginal community, who still to this day have a shorter lifespan, that [changed advice]\u00a0left a lot of Aboriginal people not able to access COVID vaccination when it was initially rolled out, which also may have given more time for doubt to be put into people's minds,\" Ms Coulson said.\u00a0", "She said mixed messaging on social media was also creating vaccine hesitancy, and there might be some socio-economic factors at play.\u00a0", "", "
The\u00a0Aboriginal\u00a0community is still at considerable risk from\u00a0COVID, but culturally sensitive health settings are helping get jabs into arms.\u00a0(ABC News: Piia Wirsu)
", "Worimi man Dr Jacob Prehn is an Indigenous Fellow and course coordinator at the University of Tasmania, and a qualified Aboriginal health worker.", "He said the lower rate of vaccination was worrying.", "\"Statistically we know Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people already experience poorer health and wellbeing outcomes on many measures,\" he said.\u00a0", "\"This, in conjunction with the communal living arrangements that are common amongst Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, creates a situation where COVID-19 could be particularly damaging if it gets established in Aboriginal communities.\"", "He said it would make sense if there was some mistrust or resentment of government among Tasmanian Aboriginal people.", "\"You need to remember that Tasmania and Australia are settler colonial states. Settler colonialism is an ongoing structure and not an event which occurred in the 1800s,\" he said.", "\"It takes time for leaders within Aboriginal communities that are trusted by Aboriginal people to say, 'Hey, getting vaccinated is a good thing, and important for you to stay healthy and safe.'\"", "Dr Prehn said there had been some innovative vaccine rollout methods for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people in other parts of the country.\u00a0", "He said the door-to-door COVID jabs used in some Aboriginal communities in Queensland, and the way Victoria was using temporary pop-up clinics in safe and accessible locations, could be considered for Tasmania.", "
Aboriginal organisations key in helping rollout
", "The gap between Indigenous and broader community vaccination rates isn't just a problem for Tasmania.", "In parts of Western Australia and Queensland, less than 40 per cent of the Indigenous populations has had at least one dose of a vaccine.\u00a0", "In September, the federal government accelerated the vaccination program for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people in 30 priority areas across the country, but none of those areas were\u00a0in Tasmania.\u00a0", "In a statement, a spokeswoman for the federal Department of Health said Tasmania's vaccination rates for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples over the age of 12 were higher than the national average, but the government recognised that further efforts were required to close the gap.", "\"Efforts continue in all communities and locations, with additional vaccine doses provided to services based on their capacity and client demand; and additional workforce support available in the form of contracted providers and funding support.\"", "Tasmanian government minister Sarah Courtney said the state government had been working on targeted vaccine programs since the beginning of the year.\u00a0", "\"We are working with a range of organisations, including Aboriginal organisations, to ensure that we have strategies in place,\" Ms Courtney said.", "", "
What you need to know about Tasmania's COVID border reopening plan.
", "Ms Coulson said the TAC was providing transport, out-of-hours clinics and family appointments to try to reduce any socio-economic barriers to vaccination.\u00a0", "She said nurse immunisers were also calling apprehensive patients to talk through concerns one on one.\u00a0", "Kylie Battese's son Damian Birch said he was now encouraging his friends to get vaccinated.", "Ms Battese is doing the same, and has\u00a0a message for anyone who is hesitant.\u00a0", "\"I made my friends around the corner get it done, they were dead against it, but they got it done,\" she said.\u00a0", "\"Definitely, everybody, get it done.\"", "", "
How to take a rapid antigen test
"]
